answers.author: Kristin Zagurski
answers.text:
Ryan,
The Town of Castle Rock, Colorado, (population about 54,000) contracts with both our local Chamber and our local, separate Economic Development Council for these types of services. You can write me with any questions, kzagurski@CRgov.com.
Kristin

answers.author: [Unknown]
answers.text:
Hi Ryan, 
Here are two documents that discuss the role of the chamber of commerce in economic development. 
-This document from the South Carolina City County Management Association shows the role that the chamber of commerce can take on in their state. icma.org/Documents/Document/Document/303475
-Confidentiality and Complexity: Unlocking the Subplots of Economic Development is an article from Pm Magazine that discusses the structure of economic development including the contributions of the local government and the chamber of commerce. http://webapps.icma.org/pm/9510/public/cover.cfm?title=Confidentiality%20and%20Complexity%3A%20Unlocking%20the%20Subplots%20of%20Economic%20Development%20&subtitle=&author=Patricia%20Mitchell%20and%20Charles%20Abernathy
Best, 
Robin Saywitz 
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
rsaywitz@icma.org

answers.author: John Zakian
answers.text:
Sorry about coming a little to the dance but a good resource is the research department of the International Economic Development Council.  As a general guide, though, a Chamber of Commerce with its foremost mission being member services and member recruitment while having compatible focus to economic development efforts does not have the broad scope bandwidth necessary to carry out an economic development strategy.  A very recent example can be found in Escambia County, FL where the regional chamber and county government has mutually decide to uncouple the chamber from providing the economic development services.

author: Ryan Adams
text:
Hello all, 
I am doing comparisons of contracts between cities and chambers of commerce for ED services.  Could anyone (or everyone) provide me with examples of cities who have contracted out a significant portion of their ED services to their local chamber of commerce.
Thank you for your help,
Ryan Adams
City of Irving, TX
rkadams@cityofirving.org
title: ED Contracts with Chambers of Commerce
